column4: Hi - I updated to 10.10, now after authenticating I get a pretty desktop background and a mouse cursor that works.. but no UI or menu or anything else
try   ctrl+alt+F1     log in     sudo  restart gdm
it sends me back to the authentication screen with (logged in) next to my username.  after I (re)authenticate it takes me back to the empty desktop :S
ok do  ctrl+a;t+F1  again   log in    then  sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade     ...when that is finished     sudo restart gdm if anything installed
it's downloading, will have the verdict in 10m or so
after the downloading - it did the same thing.  put me out to the authentication screen; after authenticating I'm back to the desktop-background image with a cursor but no menu/ui
mmm that is not good.   you installed this with live cd?
mm  ...out of curiosity ...which video card do you have?
it's a netbook, so something crappy :D
can you  alt+F2  on the desktop that has no menu?
no but I can bring up the restart/shutdown/suspend/hibernate thing
ok  I am stumped then... I also never run netbook so my little experience is not going to help with this
stick around and ask again...someone here must have some troubleshooting techniques for this
thanks for the help.  need to take off to a meeting so I will ask again when I get back.  peace
